values:
Pilate washed the blood from his hands and sealed the fate of the Lord Jesus Christ.

Broken, bent and beaten, Jesus began the long walk with his cross amid the stones and jeers of the collected Romans and Jews, taunting the Messiah as he stumbled three times.

And they tied his wrists and nailed his palms to the cross, erecting the massive wooden structure and letting him hang until dead.

And in his anguish, the lord screamed:

"My God! Why hast thou forsaken me?!?" And he passed into death.

In the night, his disciples lowered him from the cross and entombed him in the cave on the mountain. Placing a large boulder in its entry to prevent those who would defile his body.

Upon the third day, they returned to the tomb to find the stone moved and the burial shroud laying in a corner. They were afraid and angry. The went to the village to find they who had defiled the crypt and stolen the Lord.

On the road, in the morning's light, they happened upon a figure walking naked with hair flowing. As they approached, they knew it was He, who is lord.

Simon-Peter ran to the lord to embrace him.

And the Lord said unto him: "BRAINS...." And lo, did he take a large bite out of Simon-Peter's skull.

I periodically check in with the two people I list on my friends page (Two friends. How truly pathetic.), but I'm unsure if anyone actually reads the drivel I post here. (Okay, the drivel I posted here, as I haven't updated in, oh, I don't know, 74 years.) I'm not asking for feedback, but some cash, or a copy of the Silver Spoons theme would be nice from time to time. Regardless, I'm not complaining or anything. I'm really just curious. Well, curious and wondering why Black Lighting suddenly has kids, but that's another matter. So, to recap, I want to know who's here, I'm wondering what ever happened to Joel Higgins, questioning the rationality of anyone asking about the romantic life of a two-dimensional racial stereotype, and I'm annoyed that Bruce Jenner won't get out of my kitchen pantry.

At about 1:30 AM today, I was watching Cartoon Network and to what should my wandering eyes should appear but Mr.T. That's right, Cartoon Network has reached beyond the classic veil of The Gary Coleman Show, and has tapped into the creative genius of Mr. T.. This almost makes up for the trauma I suffered while, when I was dealing wiht a bout of insomnia on my trip to Texas, I was subjected to the horror that is Cuck Norris: Karate Komandoes. That was just pitiful.

Yes, my friends, I am currently making this entry from Dallas, Texas. How I got here, I'm not entirely sure, but I am happy that I will be going back to Hell's Arsehole tomorrow. (Egad, I never thought I'd conceive of THAT thought). I am here on business, which is to say, I'm not doing any site-seeing. The singular "site" is appropriate in this case.

You see, in Dallas, there is only one thing worth seeing: the location where the LAST person from Massachusetts that I know of was shot in the head by a local Texan.

Needless to say, I've been spending a lot of time in hiding while here.

For those of you who are unaware, I have known Pegasus316 for a while, having been in a band with him, as well as, for a time, living under the same roof and surreptitiously taking photos of him while he was sleeping in his underwear (sorry, man). Anyway, prior to any of this happening, when things were a bit tight, financially, for all of us, he worked in a movie theatre and I usually made my money the old-fashioned way: blackmailing random people in the phone book, convincing them that I knew something nasty about them. Now, for a tangent: Around this time, Milton Bradley had come out with a children's game called "Mr. Bucket", which I won't really bother to explain, I will just point out that the advertisements for the game had the most irritatingly catchy jingle, the lyrics of which were: I'm Mr. Bucket You drop your balls in my top, I'm Mr. Bucket Out of my mouth they will pop! I'm Mr. Bucket We're all going to run I'm Mr. Bucket Buckets of fun!" (At this time, I need to point out that Mr. Bucket is no longer available. There is some question as to whether the product was pulled because of the somewhat...homosexually suggestive jingle, or because someone made a somewhat amusing video dealing with said jingle) Back to the point... Around this time I had a bit of a psychological issue (I'm much more psychotic now, so EVERYTHING will be fine.) where I could easily get a song caught in my head. As it happens, I got the Mr. Bucket jingle stuck in my head. For about four months solid. I heard in everywhere. In the car, in the shower, in the kitchen, I would dream the damn song. Four months pass by and one day, finally, Mr. Bucket haunted me no more. (Not that I realized that, mind you. If I had, then the song would have gotten stuck in my head, again.) So, another friend of mine and I went to see Pegasus316 at work, since he was a friend of ours and we were going to head out for coffee after he got off work. We got there a few hours early, since he could get us into movie. Like I said, money was tight. Anyway... We went to meet him as he was slinging popcorn. He grabbed a couple of passes and then went to get us some popcorn. As he turned to get the fake butter-like substance, I could hear him sing under his breath... "I'm Mr. Bucket..." This, of course, got the jingle stuck in my head for another few months. On that day, back in 1995, I swore one day, I would have my revenge and get that tune stuck in his head. Today, Pegasus316, is that day! "I'm Mr. Bucket..."

As most of you are aware, I'm usually the happy-go-lucky hebephrenic that makes random observations or comments that make very little sense, but they do tend to make me laugh. hopefully, one or two of them have been amusing to you, as well.

Today, though, there is something else on my mind. 

I'm curious: have any of you ever been sitting around, minding you own business when, suddenly, a memory of a previous time in your life comes cashing through your mind, leaving a lot of damage in its wake, making you wish, beyond all reason, to be able to travel back in time to correct mistakes you made which have made irrevocable alterations in your life and karma?

There is something similar going on with me. 

A few days back, I suddenly began almost reliving a two year stretch in my mind. In that original space of time, things happened to me and because of me that have forever changed who I am. Normally, I would consider it to be a "water under the bridge" type of thing, but, for reasons I can't begin to explain, or even understand, I cannot view it in this manner. There were mistakes made and events which transpired that I want, desperately, to change. There are two problems here, though:

1. No matter how crazy I am, I am lucid enough to realize that I do not have the ability to go back in time, though I truly wish to be able to.

2. While I am stuck with the memories of this time ripping through my psyche and opening a lot of old wounds, I do not know the single occurence which, obviously, has caused me a phenomenal amount of pain, though I have a general idea of the people involved.

I want to make things right, though I doubt it would do any good at this point. A lot of time has passed. About a decade ago, a friend of mine went through something similar. We referred to it, at the time, as his "Karma Tornado". 

It appears that I am now going through my own Karma Tornado.

You have reached the Live Journal of Damien Darko. I'm unavailable to post today, as I've gone insane. If you would leave a message in the post comments area, I will get back to you once reason has been restored. Thank you.

If you've been following events on Not Your Nightmare, you know that there has been an ongoing conversation about Gary Coleman, his TV movies, his cartoon, etc. It's very informative and you should all check it out. Kevin knows more about this kind of pop-culture than even I do (and, remember, I have no life to speak of). After reading the post Kevin put up regarding The Gary Coleman Show airing on Cartoon Network, I, naturally, began setting my alarm so I could get up and watch this gem of a cartoon every morning. This has caused a trememndous lack of sleep, which may be the reason for my following call to action: People: We need to get Cartoon Network, which already has the rights to The Gary Coleman Show to put it back in production! Here's my plan: We get Cartoon Network to rework the show so that it takes place now, twenty-some years later. Gary's Character, Andy, is still an angel and still helping out around the same town. Still helping the same people (who are no longer kids, of course, but still getting in the same kind of trouble), and still trying to protect his halo from Hornswaggle, who now, inexplicably, speaks only rhyme. On top of all of this, Andy, who has not aged, will be Governor of California (Personally, I think Gary Coleman was robbed!) We need to e-mail this idea to Cartoon Network!

As you know, I've known Kevin251 for a number a minutes and he has a fairly well-established fondness for some...unique classics in terms of music. Well, today, I'm at work, working alone in our server lab and I don't have my MP3 player (because the post office sucks, but we won't go into that right now.), so I'm stuck listening only to whatever maddening song is trapped in my twisted brain at the moment. As it happens, because I'm alone, and the room is sound-proofed, I tend to sing, which is not too big a deal for me, having been a singer in the past. Unfortunately, one of my co-workers came in while I was singing at near the top of my lungs. This was embarrassing for two reasons: 1. I was singing Tarzan Boy by Baltimora. If you don't remember it from the 80's, you can Google it. 2. I do not know a SINGLE lyric to the song, or even how the tune goes, except for the odd "Tarzan-style" singing bit that appears throughout the song. THAT is what I was caught singing at the top of my lungs. Maybe I should just commit hari-kiri now.

I tried to watch the Olympics. I really tried.

Okay, this is not really true. The Olympics were on and I didn't want to expend the energy to pick up the remote and change the channel. That didn't last long. 

I realized that, apparently, I have the same opinion of the Olympics as Bill Maher. It's like watching gym class. It was one thing before they allowed professionals into the games. Let's face it, it's usually a bad sign when a member of the Kenyan basketball team's greatest hope is to personally take an elbow in the nose from Michael Jordon. (I know he's retired. I don't give enough of a damn about basketball to know who's playing anymore, and frankly, the only other professional athelete who's name I know is Tiger Woods, and I don't think he plays basketball.) 

Actually, I could (and will, I'm sure) get off on a rant in the next couple of days about professional sports, but I'm running late for work and if I don't get in the shower shortly, I'll miss my opportunity and wind up being classified as a biohazard.

This is one of those rare entries where the title has absolutly nothing to do with the content. I realize that I've not updated in a while, even though I am now out of hiding (yes, that's official). Things are kind of busy here in Hell's Arsehole. I've been having to do a lot of work around the house. I suppose I should take the time to explain my house to those of you (ie everyone) who have not seen it before. My house (or, as I like to call it: Maison di Casa) was built about 100 years ago by people who didn't quite understand the concepts of "inside" and "outside". This was, apparently, in an era I will call "Pre-Grover" (okay, it's not "near" and "far", but it's pretty close.) The way I can best explain how I came to the conclusion that these pre-humans of Nashville had difficulty with this concept bases itself around the main hallway. You see, the house is, as are many houses down here, made of brick. That is to say that the entire outside of the structure is made of red brick, giving it an appearence I can only call "bricky". Esentially, I live in a giant chineny, or at least, one would think so looking from the outside. Inside the house, there are 6 major rooms, all of which are connected by one main hall. Each room is fairly standard, being all generally rectangular in shape with whitish walls and a ceiling roughly 15 feet up. (As a side note, this is a fantastic change from my first apartment, in which I had to duck for fear of being decapitated by a ceiling fan.) The hallway, however, is not quite what one would expect. It is roughly pentangular in shape, which is not a big deal, and the ceiling is just as high. The walls are, again, whitish in colour. The odd thing, though, is they are sided. Yes, you read that correctly. My main hallway has wooden siding. So, basically, what I'm trying to say is the idiot who built my house, built it inside out.

I'm finally able to start updating this thing on a regular basis after about 2 months and, now that I can post freely, I can't think of a damn thing to say. I suppose that's just the way it goes. Oh well, I guess I'll just have to go completely random.

Who stole my pineapple?

Well, I've nothing really better to do and I can post to this thing for now, so, I figured I would do that. I don't have anything even remotely amusing to say, nor do I have any fun photos to post. No, this will probably be the blogging equivalent of mulching. Or, I could merely point to that strange little spot on your upper lip and laugh like a maniac. I'm reminded of a poetry collection I wrote several years ago that promptly disappeared into the recesses of my sock drawer, eventually to be eaten by Raoul, the Elohym Demon I keep there as a pet. The collection was called Random thoughts of the Lunatic Mind or Why Disco Can Kill You Oddly, I still remember one of the poems out of it: Thursday The day started out like any other And it ended up that way, too, So I'm not going to write much about it. Admittedly, not as clever as what is contained in Kevin 251's opus: Come, Look at my Brain, but frankly, what could match the lyric verses of such a collector of rubber chickens?

TC (who does not yet have a blog, but who will decide to create one after reading through this, hopefully), welcome to my blog. Enjoy. Look around. Look at my friend's blogs. Post messages. Remove your clothing and cover yourself with honey (or don't. That one is optional.)

A lot of people (which is to say no one, really) have asked me about my ink. Those who knew me in the past know I was, at one point, tattoo free. This has changed within the last couple of years. Actually, I now have three tattoos. The first I got is on the inside of my left wrist and looks like the image pictured here, but mine (as is correct to the actual design) has 13 small circles in the outer ring, not 8. (Yes, I am enough of a geek to not only get tattooed after a Sci-Fi tv show, t to know the design I linked to is subtly incorrect.) The second one I got is the roman numeral DCLXVI on my upper left arm. Yes, it means something and yes, to many (especially around here) it is offensive, but I like to do that to people. The last is Frank the Bunny on the outside of my right calf. There will be more at some point, though probably only two. I will keep those parties interested (re: no one, really) as I get them.

Sometimes, life gets me down. Sometimes, people really make me so angry I have the desire to paint Lou Ferrigno green. 

Sometimes, I really have the desire to dope-slap that cop who's trying to arrest me for that string of unsloved murders. Occasionally, I get so ticked off that I open fire in Wal-mart with an AK-47.

However, in times of tremendous emotional stress, I just think to myself WWJD (Waffles with Jelly Donuts). It makes me so hungry that I forget to finish murding the homeless guy I've got stashed in the trunk.

I've not been able to capture the evidence on film yet, but I have found conclusive evidence the the legendary Mr. T. is still alive. Apparently, he is living in Nashville and sells patio furiture. I'll put up the evidence when I can get my hands on it.

Yes, as I said so many moons ago, I've been in hiding. Technically, I'm still in hiding, but I'm kind of peaking, much like that famouse predictor of spring: the kilted-llama! I'll be back to my more regular updates in about 2 more weeks, but since it had been so long and the, what, 1 1/2 people who actually read this blasted thing were probably wondering if Id been killed, or worse, taken hostage by James Van Pragh to give him access to my demonic powers so he could actually read the future rather than faking it like the others. Regardless, there is much to report, including the receipt of a gift that is assured to make Kevin251 unbelievably jealous: The Atari Flashback 2! Okay, so it's not the original console, but, frankly, it's the next best thing. It works out great, too, since I've been itching to play a heated game of Combat for a while now, plus I'd always wondered what happened after Yar's Revenge (for the record, Yar went on to the previously unreleased Yar's Return). So, until next time, remember: You need three things to make a list of three intelligent things: 1. Three intelligent things. After that, I'm a bit lost.

1. I have a job that does not entail the use of the phrase "I think one of your kids tried to flush the cat"

2. The gnomes have not yet taken over the world.

3. It is still possible to use uncooked pasta as a murder weapon, then dispose of the evidence with a bit of marinara.

4. Chickens do not have opposing thumbs.

5. Stephen Spielberg has not (yet) had the idea of remaking Day of the Dead using Dakota Fanning.

6. Jell-o feels REALLY nice in my underpants.

7. The ferrets have not discoverd that I'm grape-flavoured.

8. It's still legal to keep asparagus as a pet.

9. I still regularly get to use my two favourite phrases in casual conversations. They are: "Naked, sweatty butt-sex" and "It's raining lard".

10. Eventually, gnomes will take over the world.

Well, for readsons I can't explain for reasons involving my continuing status in witness relocation, I have to say that I will be sporadically abscent for a while (probably till after the "holidays".) I'll try and check in and post some updates on my continuing quest to find a substance in the universe that is more imporant than Silly Putty.

Meanwhile, everyone have a descent I-ate-so-much-turkey-I'm-gonna-barf-on-Grandma day, a fine Newtonmas and a very happy Why-am-I-in-bed-with-this-sheep-and-why-is-it-dressed-like-Hermann-Goering day.

Now that I think on it,  I've made up my rassoodock that, at least in the short term, I'm only ittying to govoreet in Nadsat here. If you can't pony it, you can probably find the programme I'm using to translate the idividual slovos. Honestly, it's real horrorshow.

There was me, that is Damien, and I was trying to make up my rassoodock as to what to write about this evening, then I got to thinking about odin of my favourite books and sinnies A Clockwork Orange. It's a really real dobby sinny and a real dobby book. My mozg won't tell me which is better, so I ookadeet it up to you, my malenky droogs.

Anyway, when I started thinking about it, I realized I hadn't spoken nadsat, (that's the eemya for the way they govoreet in it, O my brothers.  ) and I couldn't remember how to do it. I felt totally dim. Then, I decided to smot up a Nadsat dictionary, right? Turns out, some guy out there developed a Nadsat translator. I have to govoreet, it's really real dobby.
Love means never having to say "That's $75 for oral, or $125 for all the way."

We're all, I'm sure, familiar with Einstein's theory of relativity. Many, I'm sure, are familiar with how that has progressed to string, super-string and M theory. What people may not piece together is how all of this ultimate goes to prove the supremacy of sour cream.

You see, M theory, and the precedent Quantum Theory, state that all things, matter, energy and everything else within the universe, are all different forms of the same thing (thing being used, in this case, in the relative sense, since we can't call non-things "things" in the literal sense, hence why M and Quantum give most people headaches.) The main problem with M (and, therefore Quantum, Super-string, String and relativity) is that they don't quite take the theory far enough. That is why I am hereby making the announcement of having finally conceived the truth of the universe:


The universe, and all matter, energy and various other bits contained therein are all composed of different forms and states of sour cream.

There. now we can lay off all this silly science and get back to the more noble pursuits of better water-skis.

So, if you don't remember, or weren't aware in the first place, Halloween is kind of my time, since I have an affinity for special effects make-up (and watching Stranger on a Train dubbed into Norwegian, but that's another matter.)

I haven't been able to do much for halloween the last few years for various reason including, but not limited to, incarceration on charges of conspiracy to commit parking violations.

This year was different, though. I was available, free on my own recognizance and able to go to a few large scale halloween parties.

As I've discussed before, I live in Nashville, which is kind of an oxymorn, since it is impossible to actually live in Nashville, merely exist. Regardless, as many of you know, Nashville is the buckle of the Bible-belt. It makes for have a good time in my normal, debaucherous way, a little difficult most of the time.

That brings me to the story of the parties I went to this year. I hit two of them. At each one of them, people, as expected, were dressed in various odd costumes. (I did my tribute to Tom Savini). What was unexpected, however was the young ladies dressed, literally, in nothing but latex body paint. Without getting into too much detail, I can tell you with some degree of certainty that they were cold.

Also surprising was the young woman I observed having sex at three different times with three different partners. I did not observe her leaving towards a back room with them, or going off to a car with them. No, I observed her bending over a table for them.

I'll tell you, nights like these make me think that Nashville may not be as lame as I initially thought.

To quote (or maybe paraphrase...or maybe misattribute) Salvador Dali:

Why is it when I order dinner in a fine restaraunt, the waiter never brings me a flaming phone book?

For those of you who are not aware, my parents (now retired) have a winter condo on Florida's Gulf Coast. (I'm sure you can already figure out where I'm going with this.)

They arrived for the winter 2 days ago.

For those of you not paying attention, that was roughly the time that Wilma (now classified as either the most powerful storm recorded in the Atlantic, or ever depending on what source you go to) was named. 

I'm thinking the weather has it out for my family.

Damn weather should never have made it personal. Now I'm going to have to get mean.

I know some of you are wondering why I write in spurts. This is, primarily, because I have a leaky pen, however, the reason I post here in an odd schedule (ie, not the same amount per day, or even the same number of days between posts) it's simple:

I don't exist. 

Yes, now you know.

I'm not real.

You all made me up. 

I am the odd part of your brain that makes you think things like: "I find it odd that Ashton Kutcher and Phil Collins have never done a charity benefit together while wearing a tutu and a Kaiser helmet."

Basically, I'm the you that you would want to be if you were me and you wanted you to be someone else, so the only other option, in a cosmic sense would be to be me.

D.
I've often wondered why the concept of "taking a crap" seemed so normal to people. Frankly, I find the idea of taking a crap to be rather disgusting. LEAVING a crap, however, is not so nasty. D.

Okay, I've spent the last few days running from a somewhat...irritated mob across the state of Alabama. It seems they are a bit touchy about the whole abortion thing. I suppose trying to calm them down by repeatedly shouting "Jesus liked to touch little boys" was probably not the best tactic I've ever had, either.

Regardless, I'm back on the campaign trail and I'm heading toward my next stop: Crawford, Texas.

In Crawford, I will be giving a speech titled "Why did you goat-rapers elect Bush?"

I'm thinking it will be a big success.

D.

Yes, ladies and gentlemen, I've threatened to do this before, but now, I can legally do this:

I am officially announcing my candidacy for President of the United States in 2008. 

Some will ask what my platform is. Well, it is, at the moment, a work in progress. Here's what I have so far:

1. If elected, the military will never again have a shortage of bunnies. 

2. I will guarantee some pot for every chicken.

3. If elected...Spirographs for Everyone!

4. I will appoint Adam West ambassador to the UN, however, I would require that he wear the Batman costume...for...national security.

So, that's all I have right now, but I'll be coming up with more soon.

In the mean time, I will be hitting the trail. First stop will be tomorrow in Snodgrass, Alabama where I will be providing free abortions to everyone...even the men.

Until then, remember:

A vote for Damien Darko is a vote for Ponies!

Aquaman is part man and part fish.

What kind of wine would you serve with him?

Also, does anyone else think that the teletubbies would taste like chicken?

And it's playing on Sci-Fi as I type. I am referring, of course, to Supernova. If you have not seen this movie, we;ll you're in the vast majority. I, however, was dumb enough to have paid money to see this when it was in theatres. It is a decision I regret nearly as much as when I mistakenly went to see Left Behind, thinking it was a disaster movie, rather than a disaster of a movie. The plot of Supernova can best be described as "crap with shit dressing". It revolves around a hospital ship going after some odd distress call, being hit by...oh, I don't know...maybe a bus, then it picks up some guy who looks kinda like James Caviezel, but doesn't seem to have the acting skills of a brick. So the lookalike has some kind of superpowers that he got from a cosmic lava-lamp. These powers appear to allow him to seduce Robin Tunney (which, frankly, doesn't seem that difficult). Somehow or another, pretty much everyone dies in a spectacularly unimpressive manner, and Robin Tunney exposes her breasts in a spectacularly unimpressive manner. Probably the one thing that could have saved this movie would be Bill Cosby's super hero from Fat Albert: The Brown Hornet D.

I don't know what the price of gas is where you all are. Here, gas is floating around $3.00 a gallon. Frankly, it's ridiculous.

You know who I feel sorry for, though? Rich people. 

See, I have this pity on the people who have spent so much money on vehicles designed specifically to be status-symbol, but now they can't afford to fill it.

So, being the enterprising, yet somewhat strange individual I am, I have a solution.

I have just begun mass production on the newest status-symbol for the wealthy who just want to show it off:

The Chauffeur-driven Pogo-Stick.

Get yours now for only $103,234,353,004.99 MSRP


D.

Okay, I am still here, and I've still got penguins held hostage in my basement. This should surprise no one as it was always my life-long dream to have a group of hostage penguins. 

Anyway, I'm still alive, at least as far as an imaginary Dark Lord of Cheese-flavour products can be alive.

There are two things I want to know:

What is the square root of a walrus?

And

Who told Rob Scheinder that he can drive my car?



D.

The Best News I've Heard in a While. I had planned to not write anymore today, but I ran across this and I knew that some of the geezers I used to run with back around The Grind would be interested. D.

Mainly because it's an unbelievably slow day at work. Another reason is that I'm hoping this gets to people who haven't seen me since I left Rook back in 97 and are wondering "What ever happened to that obnoxious bastard?" Well, those who knew me then knew I smoked more than the average smouldering tire-pile. I'm proud to say that as of Wednesday, Sept 14, 2005, that's no longer the case. Of course, my use of heroine has tripled, but that's okay. I'm still into music, though I have not been a member of a band in about two years. That's the odd thing about living here in Hell's Arsehole, they call this "Music City", but the description could more accurately be "Bad Music City". Think about it: Most of you have heard country music on the radio at one point and thought "Man, that sucks! How in the name of Ahura-Mazda did that get on the radio?" Well, imagine living in a city full...FULL of people who play and write country music that is so bad, they won't put it on the radio, especially considering what they DO put on the radio. Welcome to my hell. D.

So, out of curiosity, and mainly to see how well Kevin 251 is doing, I did a Google on the title of his poetry collection: Come, Look at my Brain. Oddly, the first entry on Google said this: My Brain My Brain for sale. Check out the deals now! www.eBay.com This leads me to the question: Kevin, Lad, are you THAT hard up for cash? D.

Prior to living in New England, I lived in Upstate New York, near the Saratoga Horse Track. 

There was a superstition there (and, I think around other horse tracks, as well) that it was a huge stroke of good luck to find a $2 bill. The superstition said that you should never spend a found $2 bill, but keep it with you at all times.

I tell you this to explain what happened yesterday and why it seems so odd to me.

Yesterday afternoon, leaving work, I found some money on the ground. That part is not so unusual, of course. Lucky, to be sure, but not unheard of.

The difference this time is the fact that the money consisted of not one, but five $2 bills. Even more strange was the fact that the five bills had sequential serial numbers.

I suppose the people in Saratoga would want me to bet on the Exacta.



D.

I have no particular reason for wanting to talk about bananas. I haven't eaten one in a few weeks, so they aren't even really on my mind.

They are an excellent source of potassium, so we should all eat more of them, but that's not really the point.

Has anyone else ever actually TRIED to slip on a banana peel? I've never actually gotten it to work. A grape, sure, but never a banana peel.

And why do so many people think bananas are funny? You see them used in old slap-stick comedies and they always seemed to get a laugh.

Why do people say that something crazy is "bananas?" Don't you think that's a little insulting to the banana? Why don't we call crazy things "blueberries"?

D.

What is the problem with having your cake and eating it, too? I hear that it's impossible, but I find it very simple. Just sit there (or stand, lay down, or what have you) with the cake, then when you get bored, eat the damn thing.

Unless it's have your cake in a sexual sense, in which case, it's still possible, but a little disgusting.



D.

So I had the most insanely bizarre dream. I think it may have been partially influenced by a conversation I had yesterday about The Gong Show. 

In my dream, I was in a competition to host a children's TV show. Probably the strangest part about that is the fact that my view on children is about the same as my view on processed luncheon meat: Tasty, but I don't want them anywhere near me.

So during this competition, I wound up partnering up with Captain Kangaroo, which was kind of a trip, since I grew up watching that show. The two of us started tripping out on the Nitrous Oxide from whipped cream cans and then we started with the random hijinx, which were being judged by Arte Johnson, Jamie Farr and Jaye P. Morgan. Upon receiving a low judgement, the two of us began screeching like banshees and beating the crap out of Gene Gene the Dancing Machine.


After that, it gets too strange to try to describe.


D.

10. Shave random stripes into the hair on your head. If you get really bored, try shaving designs.

9. Make a random phone call and try to strike up a conversation with a total stranger. (bonus if you can do this in the middle of the night.)

8. Go to the supermarket and rearrange the food. Don't change the prices as that would be illegal.

7. Play tag with total strangers. Don't tell them before hand.

6. Find a bible-thumper on the street who is shouting the "good word". Stand next to him and shout just as loudly about the joys of sodomy.

5. Find a mounted policeman and start a conversation with their horse.

4. Build an anatomically correct snow family.

3. Dress like a homeless person and stand on a street corner with a sign that reads "Your Message Here: $5 a day".

2. In a crowded elevator, suddenly shout "Spider-sense: TINGLING!"

1. Legally change your name to First Middle Last and see how long it takes to get a loan application processed.


D.

I'm familiar with the concept of "casual sex". It's a phrase that gets thrown around as much as "moral relativism". It leaves a very interesting question, though:

Would the opposite of casual sex be formal sex? And if so, does that mean that it becomes a black tie affair? What if it's not an affair at all, but formal sex with your significant other? Does that mean that it is impossible to have formal sex with your regular partner?

D.

Right now you're asking: "Double-D, why is this thing called Tea and Beef Jerky?" First, don't ever call me Double-D again. Second, I've decided to call this Tea and Beef Jerky because I am currently working on a story which will hopefully become a book which will hopefully be the first in a series, all of which will be called Tea and Beef Jerky. And what does Tea and Beef Jerky have to do with...well tea and/or beef jerky? Well, not much. Actually, nothing. I just always though that particular combination of words went together pretty well. Kind of like Marshmallows and Vespa Scooters. D.
